creator: dan+apachebugs@cabnumbers.com
text:
The httxt2dbm program will not delete entries from the map that are no longer present in the source text file. This behaviour is not obvious from the man page ("httxt2dbm is used to generate dbm files from text input") and should be clearly documented or fixed appropriately.

To demonstrate:

# echo -e 'fookey\tbarvalue' | httxt2dbm -i - -o foo.map
# strings foo.map 
barvalue
fookey
# echo -e 'newkey\tnewvalue' | httxt2dbm -i - -o foo.map
# strings foo.map 
newvalue
newkey
barvalue
fookey

This has been taken into account in trunk.
Thanks

r1442400
creator: christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr
